install_tidymass

Source: R/install_tidymass.R
install_tidymass.Rd

Install all packages in tidymass.

install_tidymass(
  from = c("github", "gitee"),
  force = FALSE,
  upgrade = "never",
  dependencies = NA,
  demo_data = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

from

From github or gitee, if you are in China, try to set this as "gitee".
force

Force installation, even if the remote state has not changed since the previous install.
upgrade

One of "default", "ask", "always", or "never". "default" respects the value of the R_REMOTES_UPGRADE environment variable if set, and falls back to "ask" if unset. "ask" prompts the user for which out of date packages to upgrade. For non-interactive sessions "ask" is equivalent to "always". TRUE and FALSE are also accepted and correspond to "always" and "never" respectively.
dependencies

Which dependencies do you want to check? Can be a character vector (selecting from "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo", "Suggests", or "Enhances"), or a logical vector.TRUE is shorthand for "Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo" and "Suggests". NA is shorthand for "Depends", "Imports" and "LinkingTo" and is the default. FALSE is shorthand for no dependencies (i.e. just check this package, not its dependencies). The value "soft" means the same as TRUE, "hard" means the same as NA.
demo_data

Install demo_data package or not.
...

Other parameters from devtools::install_github() or devtools::install_git()

Author

Xiaotao Shen shenxt@stanford.edu
